    version 0.0.0.900 - first dev version

    Thomas Goossens

    11/21/2018

    version-0.0.0.900-first-dev-version.Rmd

    This version implements the ZEPP method : multiple linear regression based and X, Y and alt.

    To understand the settings described belo, please read the mlr doc : https://mlr.mlr-org.com

    implemented learners

    multiple linear regressions

    learner = regr.lm tuning = FALSE auto-tuning = FALSE feature-filtering = FALSE feature-selection = FALSE

    learner = mlr::makeLearner(cl = "regr.lm", id = "multiple-linear-reg", predict.type = "se")

    implemented features

    example

    library(agrometeoR)
# create the regression task for a specific hour for a specific sensor
task = makeTask(date = "2017-05-24", sensor = "tsa")
# create the model based on the task
model = makeModel(
  task = task$task,
  learner = mlr::makeLearner(cl = "regr.lm", id = "multiple-linear-reg", predict.type = "se"))
# create the geojson spatialized file
makeSpatialization(
  model = model$model,
  name = model$model$task.desc$id,
  path = getwd(),
  )
